network

Interface Protocol

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientPeer, ServerPeer

    public interface Protocol

    • Field Detail

      • PORTNUMBER

        static final int PORTNUMBER
        Value for the standart port.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_JOINREQUEST

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_JOINREQUEST
        Used for joining a server (or a.k.a. "lobby") Arguments: - name = Name of the client - chat = Whether the client supports chat or not - challenge = Whether the client supports challenge or not - leaderboard = Whether the client supports leaderboard or not - security = Whether the client supports security functionalities or not Requirements for arguments: - chat = 0 || 1 - challenge = 0 || 1 - leaderboard = 0 || 1 - security = 0 || 1 Example: My client, Pittt, wants to join and only support the chat feature Code: "joinrequest Pittt 1 0 0 0" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_ACCEPTJOIN

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_ACCEPTJOIN
        Used for accepting the client request to join the server and notify the client of the features that the server supports. Arguments: - name = Name of the client - chat = Whether the client supports chat or not - challenge = Whether the client supports challenge or not - leaderboard = Whether the client supports leaderboard or not - security = Whether the client supports security functionalities or not Requirements for arguments: - chat = 0 || 1 - challenge = 0 || 1 - leaderboard = 0 || 1 - security = 0 || 1 Example: Following up on the before mentioned joinrequest, the server only support the challenge feature and the leaderboard. code: "acceptjoin Pittt 0 1 1 0 Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_DENYJOIN

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_DENYJOIN
        Used to deny the client if the name is already in use. Argument: name : Name of the client Requirements for arguments: - name is not allowed to contain spaces Example: If there is already a client named 'pittt' code: "denyjoin pittt" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_GAMEREQUEST

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_GAMEREQUEST
        Used to let the server know that the client wants to start a game with x amount of player. code: "gamerequest 2" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_STARTGAME

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_STARTGAME
        Used to let the clients know that a game has been started. Arguments: - name1 = Name of the first player - name2 = Name of the second player - name3 Example: A game is being started for the clients 'pittt' and 'teun' code: "startgame pittt teun" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_MOVEREQUEST

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_MOVEREQUEST
        Used by the server to let the client know that he has to do a move. Arguments: - name = name of the player whose turn it is Example: It is my turn to do a move code: "moverequest pittt" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_SETMOVE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_SETMOVE
        Used by the client to do a move. Arguments: - x = x Coordinate on the board - y = y Coordimate onm the board - size = size of the ring on the board Example: I want to place a move on the position x = 1 && y = 1 && ring_size = 2 && color = RED code: "setmove 1 1 2 1" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_DENYMOVE

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_DENYMOVE
        Used to deny a move if the move is not valid. code: "denymove pittt " Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_NOTIFYMOVE

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_NOTIFYMOVE
        Used to let the clients know that a move has been made. Arguments: - name = Name of the client that performed the move - x = x Coordinate on the board - y = y Coordinate on the board - size = size of the ring on the board Example: pittt placed a move on x = 1 && y = 0 && size = 1 && colour =1 code: "notifymove pittt 1 0 1 1" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_GAMEOVER

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_GAMEOVER
        Used to announce that the game is over Arguments: - name = Name of the client that won the game. Example: teun wins the game code: "gameover teun" Draw between teun and pittt code: "gameover teun pittt" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_CONNECTIONLOST

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_CONNECTIONLOST
        Used when one client disconnects from the server. Arguments: - name = name of the player who disconnected Example: teun rage quites because he is losing code: "connectionlost teun" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_INVALIDCOMMAND

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_INVALIDCOMMAND
        Used everytime a client tries to perform an invalid command. Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_CHATE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_CHATE
        Used to send chat messages to the server. Argument: - message = The message that you want to send to the server Example: code: chat pittt "this is a test message" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_SENDCHAT

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_SENDCHAT
        Used to broadcast the message to all the clients that support the chat feature. Argument: - message = The message that you want to send to the server Example: code: sendChat pittt "this is a test message" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_REQUESTCHALLENGELIST

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_REQUESTCHALLENGELIST
        Used to request a list of all the clients that support the challenge feature. Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_CHALLENGELIST

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_CHALLENGELIST
        Used to send the clients that support the challenge feature Direction: Server -> Client Example: Pittt request the challenge list. Teun, steen and arthur support the feature code: challengelist Teun steen arthur
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_REQUESTCHALLENGE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_REQUESTCHALLENGE
        Used to send a challenge to the other client. Arguments: - name = Name of the client that you want to challenge Example: I (Pittt) want to challenge teun to a game code: "requestchallenge teun" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_NOTIFYCHALLENGE

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_NOTIFYCHALLENGE
        Used to notify the client that someone else is challenging him. Arguments: - name = Name of the client that is challenging you Example: teun challenges me to a game code: "notifychallenge teun" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_CHALLENGERESPONSE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_CHALLENGERESPONSE
        Used by the client that got challenged to answer the challenge. Arguments: - answer = The answer to the challenge - name = Name of the client that challenged Requirements for arguments: - answer = 0 || 1 Example: I am responding to the challenge that teun send me, and I accept it code: "answerchallenge victor 1" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_RESULTCHALLENGE

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_RESULTCHALLENGE
        Used to notify the other client whether the challenge has been accepted or not. Arguments: - answer = The answer to the challenge - name = Name of the client that answered the challenge Requirements for arguments: - answer = 0 || 1 Example: My previous response that is being broadcasted to the challenger (teun) code: "resultchallenge Pittt 1" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_REQUESTLEADERBOARD

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_REQUESTLEADERBOARD
        Used by the client to request the leaderboard from the server. Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_SETLEADERBOARD

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_SETLEADERBOARD
        Used to send the data of the game to the leaderboard. Can be ignored if the server saves the data to the leaderboard. Arguments: - name = Name of the player - score = The score of the game - time = date and time when the game was played Requirements for arguments: - score = 0 || 1 || 3 0 = loss 1 = draw 3 = win (also the client that disconnects, loses the game) - time = UNIX Timestamp Example: I won my last game code: "setleaderboard Pttt 3 1484670803" Direction: Client -> Server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_BROADCASTLEADERBOARD

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_BROADCASTLEADERBOARD
        Used to broadcast the leaderboard to the clients Arguments: - name = Name of the player - score = The score of the game - time = date and time when the game was played Note: This is done as often as needed. Untill all the entries in the leaderboard are returned Example: There are 2 entries in the leaderbaord. 1 draw and 1 game that I lost code: "broadcastleaderboard Pittt 1 1484670803 Pittt 0 1484671115" Direction: Server -> Client
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_PUBLICKEY

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_PUBLICKEY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_ENCRYPTPASS
        See Also:
